alert.note: Alert for Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern New Hanover, southern Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Long Creek, or 11 miles southwest of Burgaw, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Hightsville, Long Creek, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wrightsboro, Montague, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Castle Hayne, Phoenix, Kings Grant, Belville, and Navassa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 412 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
